item.title: Stardew Valley – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition now available
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

A free upgrade from the Switch version.

Stardew Valley – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition is now available via Nintendo eShop for $14.99. Users who own the Switch version can upgrade to the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition via a free “Upgrade Pack.”

Stardew Valley first launched for PC via Steam on February 26, 2016, followed by Linux and Mac on July 29, 2016, PlayStation 4 on December 13, 2016, Xbox One on December 14, 2016, Switch on October 5, 2017, PS Vita on May 22, 2018, iOS on October 24, 2018, and Android on March 14, 2019. The PC version is also available via GOG and Humble Store.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nintendo eShop:

About

You’re moving to the valley…

You’ve inherited your grandfather’s old farm plot in Stardew Valley.

Armed with hand-me-down tools and a few coins, you set out to begin your new life. Can you learn to live off the land and turn these overgrown fields into a thriving home? It won’t be easy. Ever since Joja Corporation came to town, the old ways of life have all but disappeared. The community center, once the town’s most vibrant hub of activity, now lies in shambles. But the valley seems full of opportunity. With a little dedication, you might just be the one to restore Stardew Valley to greatness!

Now with Multiplayer! Invite up to seven players to join you in the valley! Players can work together to build a thriving farm, share resources, and build relationships with townspeople or each other. As more hands are better than one, players have the option to scale profit margin on produce sold for a more challenging experience.

Nintendo Switch 2 Edition Features

  • With intuitive mouse controls, placing furniture and organizing your inventory is easy.
  • Local split-screen cooperative supports up to four players.
  • Online multiplayer supports up to eight players.
  • With Game Share, just one copy is all it takes—invite up to three friends to play, even if they don’t own the game.


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/stardew-valley-nintendo-switch-2-edition-now-available
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Dragon Quest X Online version 8.0 expansion launches June 25, 2026 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • Switch

More information to be announced at Dragon Quest X Spring Festival 2026.

Dragon Quest X Online‘s version 8.0 expansion, Dragon Quest X Online: Stray Children of Space and Time, will launch for PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC on June 25, 2026 in Japan for 4,950 yen, Square Enix announced.

The version 8.0 expansion will feature a new story, new characters, and more, with further information to be announced at Dragon Quest X Spring Festival 2026 on March 20 and 21.

In addition to the standalone release, a Dragon Quest X Online All-In-One Package Version 1-8 will also be available for 5,940 yen, which includes the base game and all previously released updates and expansions.

Visit the newly launched version 8.0 expansion official website here.

Watch an archive of today’s Super Dragon Quest X TV Extra Edition: Adventurers’ Christmas Special 2025 below.

Super Dragon Quest X TV Extra Edition: Adventurers’ Christmas Special 2025



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/dragon-quest-x-online-version-8-0-expansion-launches-june-25-2026-in-japan
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 12/15/25 – 12/21/25
item.content:encoded:
Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for week of December 15, 2025 to December 21, 2025.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 221,033 units, the Switch family sold 38,184 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 19,307 units, the Xbox Series family sold 184  units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 12 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [SW2] Mario Kart World (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 115,729 (2,573,736)
  2. [NSW] Pokemon Legends: Z-A (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) – 72,820 (1,470,354)
  3. [SW2] Pokemon Legends: Z-A – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) – 54,096 (957,286)
  4. [SW2] Kirby Air Riders (Nintendo, 11/20/25) – 49,220 (377,044)
  5. [SW2] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Konami, 11/13/25) – 26,323 (158,381)
  6. [NSW] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen (Konami, 11/13/25) – 22,898 (199,905)
  7. [SW2] Donkey Kong Bananza (Nintendo, 07/17/25) – 16,165 (419,948)
  8. [NSW] Minecraft (Microsoft, 06/21/18) – 16,038 (4,094,207)
  9. [SW2] Super Mario Party Jamboree – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Jamboree TV (Nintendo, 07/24/25) – 14,268 (111,628)
  10. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 13,352 (8,297,279)

Rankings 11 to 30 will be published on December 26.

  1. [SW2] Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment (Koei Tecmo, 11/06/25) –

  6. [NSW] Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 10/30/25) –

item.title: GANG OF DRAGON Steam page updated with new screenshots
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Several new looks at the upcoming action adventure game.

Nagoshi Studio has updated the Steam page for recently announced Kabukicho-set action adventure game GANG OF DRAGON with several new screenshots.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nagoshi Studio:

An action adventure set in Kabukicho, the iconic nightlife district of Shinjuku, Tokyo.

Shin Ji-seong—portrayed by renowned Asian actor Ma Dong-seok—is a high-ranking member of a Korean crime syndicate based in Kabukicho. As he explores the streets of Shinjuku, Shin becomes entangled in underworld conflicts and forges intense, human connections that push him to confront his own sense of purpose.

Combat unfolds from a third-person perspective, centered on Shin’s overwhelming physical power. Engage enemies through brutal hand-to-hand strikes, precise blade attacks, gunplay, and high-impact vehicle action across the city.

Forge your own path through a story where violence and human bonds intertwine.

GANG OF DRAGON will be available for PC via Steam. Additional platforms have yet to be announced.

View the screenshots at the gallery.

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/gang-of-dragon-steam-page-updated-with-new-screenshots

item.title: Exist Archive: The Other Side of the Sky to be delisted on January 1, 2026 for PS4 in Japan, January 5 for PS Vita
item.content:encoded:
• PS Vita
  • PS4

tri-Ace-developed RPG ending production.

Spike Chunsoft will delist the digital version of tri-Ace-developed RPG Exist Archive: The Other Side of the Sky for PlayStation 4 on January 1, 2026 at 00:00 JST in Japan, and for PS Vita on January 5, 2026 at 00:00 JST, the company announced. This will include both the base game and downloadable content. New production of the physical edition will also end.

Exist Archive: The Other Side of the Sky first launched for PlayStation 4 and PS Vita on December 17, 2015 in Japan, followed by a global release on October 18, 2016.

Western publisher Aksys Games has yet to announce whether it plans to delist the game.

Here is an overview of the game, via Aksys Games:

Exist Archive: The Other Side of the Sky is an RPG where Kanata and various others have been imbued with pieces of the dark god, Yamatoga’s soul and are sent to Protolexa, for reasons unbeknownst to them.

Battle enemies and the armies of Chasseur as you search out for your other teammates, complete quests and side events, and learn the truth of why you have been chosen.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/exist-archive-the-other-side-of-the-sky-to-be-delisted-on-january-1-2026-for-ps4-in-japan-january-5-for-ps-vita
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Fruit Mountain Party coming to Switch 2, Switch in spring 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch
  • Switch 2

Currently in Early Access for PC.

BeXide will release Switch 2 and Switch versions of multiplayer party 3D puzzle game Fruit Mountain Party in spring 2026, the developer announced.

Fruit Mountain Party first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on August 28.

The Switch version of Fruit Mountain Party will be playable for the first time at Osaka Game Dungeon, which will take place on December 27 at MyDome Osaka, as well as Tokyo eSports Festa 2026, which will run from January 9, 2026 to January 11 at Tokyo Big Sight.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A brand new game in the hit 3D puzzle game Fruit Mountain where you combine fruits to make them bigger is finally here!

This time, it’s fruit battles!? There are plenty of versus modes that everyone can enjoy!

Get together for online or local multiplayer and have a blast!

Keep stacking those fruits!

Key Features

  • Heated Online Battle Mode
    • Compete with friends and players from around the world in a battle mode for up to four players!
    • Will you compete in a serious time attack? Or maybe a chaotic battle full of items and unexpected accidents?
    • Get ready for exciting matches with a variety of rules!
  • Single-Player Mode Supports Rankings
    • The single-player mode is still available!
    • Compete with players from around the world for the highest score!
  • Easy to Play
    • Simply throw fruits and stack them on the plate.
    • Combine fruits of the same kind to make them bigger!
    • Game over if the fruits fall off the plate!
    • Create big fruits or trigger chains to boost your score with combo!
    • Hone your stacking skills and compete with your rivals!

Watch the Switch 2 and Switch announcement trailer below.

Switch 2 and Switch Announce Trailer

English

Japanese

Simplified Chinese



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/fruit-mountain-party-coming-to-switch-2-switch-in-spring-2026
